intro: Trachelosiphon columbianum, commonly known as the Columbian sea lettuce, is a green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like thallus that can grow up to several centimeters in length. This species typically thrives in marine environments, often found attached to rocks or other substrates in shallow coastal waters. Its structure consists of a single layer of cells, making it a simple yet efficient photosynthetic organism. Trachelosiphon columbianum plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various small marine organisms.
